work.name: Q-Lab
work.summary: Developing simulation frameworks using Vision and Language Models for dynamic world building and autonomous agent training.
highlights: Built a simulation framework powered by Large Language Models (LLMs) to generate dynamic, interactive virtual worlds, enabling real-time collaboration between autonomous agents.
Engineered 200+ lifelike character animations in Unreal Engine 5.3, improving realism and social interaction fidelity in Large World Models .

Trained over 50 context-aware autonomous agents by combining reinforcement learning with chain-of-thought reasoning, significantly improving their ability to interpret natural language prompts and respond to environmental cues.
Paper under review for top-tier conference

work.name: Knight Lab
work.summary: Applied deep learning, CI/CD engineering, and software architecture to accelerate microbial genomics research through scalable ML pipelines.
highlights: Developed and trained deep learning models using TensorFlow to analyze 16S rRNA genomic data, increasing species identification accuracy from 65% to over 90%.
Engineered a robust CI/CD pipeline for model development and deployment using Docker, Kubernetes, and Git, enabling automated testing and faster iteration.
Streamlined the machine learning workflow by implementing object-oriented design patterns (Singleton, Decorator), reducing pipeline complexity and cutting development time by 20%.
Built a failure-tolerant training pipeline in Python on Ubuntu, integrating automated testing and anomaly detection to ensure model reliability and scalability.

work.name: UC San Diego
work.summary: Guided incoming students through their first quarter at UCSD, providing academic and social support.
highlights: Guided 60+ incoming freshmen through their transition to college life by fostering a welcoming and inclusive environment.
Facilitated group activities, encouraged participation, and mediated interpersonal dynamics to ensure a positive orientation experience.
Provided personalized support to students by addressing academic and logistical concerns, including course enrollment guidance and resource referrals.
Developed leadership, communication, and conflict-resolution skills by managing both group dynamics and individual needs.
Successfully created a foundation for new students to navigate university life with confidence and a sense of belonging.

work.name: Consat Orahi
work.summary: Leveraged data analytics and visualization tools to uncover workforce trends and support decision-making in employee management.
highlights: Collected and processed access card data using Python and Pandas to analyze employee attendance patterns.
Built an interactive Tableau dashboard visualizing trends across 3 fiscal quarters, enabling management to identify attendance irregularities and workflow patterns.
Presented data-driven insights and proposed actionable strategies to leadership, contributing to improved workforce management and resource allocation.

work.name: G-Square Solutions
work.summary: Built predictive machine learning models to forecast buyer interest in real estate markets using large-scale interaction data.
highlights: Designed a machine learning pipeline using scikit-learn to predict property buyer interest across major Indian real estate markets.
Engineered and cleaned a training dataset of 700,000+ customer-broker interactions using Pandas and Seaborn, ensuring high-quality input for model training.
Achieved 94.5% classification accuracy using Gradient Boosting and Random Forest, with the model later sold to a real estate company.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams, including sales and data departments, to align deliverables with business objectives.

projects.name: Full Stack RAG Web App

volunteer.organization: Computer Science and Engineering Society (CSES) Innovate
volunteer.summary: Leading a student-driven research organization focused on machine learning and social impact projects, including early skin cancer detection through deep learning.
highlights: President of a 40+ member student research society, overseeing project incubation, cross-disciplinary collaboration, and event organization.
Organized faculty panels and large-scale research events connecting students with academic researchers and industry mentors.
Spearheading a medical AI initiative to develop a CNN-based model for skin lesion classification using dermoscopic imagery and datasets like HAM10000.
Project UI designed with Flutter and Firebase, enabling real-time data collection and model inference on mobile devices.
Designed and implemented preprocessing techniques (normalization, data augmentation) to improve model robustness in detecting melanoma and other lesions.
Also led the development of a transformer-based deep learning model to convert isolated instrument audio into numerical token sequences for sheet music generation.
